title: "Undergraduate Final Submission Checklist"
sidebar: pages
---

Complete this checklist as a team before submitting your white paper.

## Project Requirements

### Paper Content (3,000-4,000 words)
- [ ] Title and abstract (100-150 words)
- [ ] Introduction section (~800-1,000 words)
- [ ] Literature review section (~600-800 words)
- [ ] Methods section (~400-600 words)
- [ ] Results section (~400-600 words)
- [ ] Discussion section (~600-800 words)
- [ ] References section (all sources cited)

### Research Requirements
- [ ] One original survey with N=100+ responses
- [ ] Survey data collected and exported as CSV
- [ ] Data cleaned in R
- [ ] Two Research Questions (RQs) and/or Hypotheses (RHs) stated clearly
- [ ] Data analysis performed in RStudio
- [ ] At least two data visualizations (tables/figures) created in R

### Citation Requirements
- [ ] 10-12 academic sources cited
- [ ] All citations formatted consistently
- [ ] References listed alphabetically
- [ ] All in-text citations have corresponding references

### Writing & Formatting
- [ ] Title is clear and descriptive
- [ ] Professional, journalistic tone throughout
- [ ] No jargon without explanation
- [ ] Spell-checked and proofread by all team members
- [ ] Consistent formatting and heading levels
- [ ] Figures and tables have clear labels and captions

## Technical Requirements

### RStudio Project
- [ ] Team has shared RStudio project cloned from GitHub
- [ ] `white_paper.qmd` file created with proper structure
- [ ] `references.bib` file with all citations
- [ ] `/data` folder with survey data (raw and cleaned)
- [ ] `/output` folder with final PDF

### Quarto Document
- [ ] YAML header includes:
  - [ ] `title:` (your white paper title)
  - [ ] `author:` (all team members' names)
  - [ ] `bibliography: references.bib` (if using citations)
  - [ ] `format: pdf`
- [ ] All R code chunks work and include comments
- [ ] Visualizations (plots, tables) properly created and labeled

### Rendering
- [ ] Document renders to PDF without errors
- [ ] PDF is readable and properly formatted
- [ ] All figures and tables appear correctly
- [ ] Page numbers visible in PDF
- [ ] No broken links or missing images

## GitHub Repository

### Repository Setup
- [ ] Private GitHub repository created
- [ ] Repository named clearly (e.g., `white-paper-f25`)
- [ ] README.md file explains the project
- [ ] All team members invited as collaborators
- [ ] All team members can access and edit

### Repository Contents
- [ ] RStudio project files included
- [ ] `white_paper.qmd` file committed
- [ ] `references.bib` file committed
- [ ] `/data` folder with cleaned survey data
- [ ] `/output` folder with final PDF
- [ ] `.gitignore` configured for the project

### Git Workflow (Team Collaboration)
- [ ] Commits made throughout the project (not just at the end)
- [ ] Commit messages are clear and descriptive
- [ ] All team members have made commits
- [ ] Branches used for different sections (recommended)
- [ ] All changes merged to main branch
- [ ] All changes pushed to remote repository
- [ ] No uncommitted changes at submission time

### Collaboration Checklist
- [ ] Team roles assigned (who wrote what section)
- [ ] Regular commits indicate collaborative work
- [ ] Each team member made meaningful contributions
- [ ] No one person did all the work

## Submission

### GitHub Repository
- [ ] Repository is private (not public)
- [ ] All team members have access
- [ ] README.md is clear and informative
- [ ] Latest version of all files committed and pushed
- [ ] No sensitive data in repository

### Final Deliverables
- [ ] GitHub link provided to instructor
- [ ] Final PDF generated and saved in `/output`
- [ ] All project files uploaded to GitHub
- [ ] Repository organized and clean

### If Submitting to Blackboard
- [ ] Final PDF uploaded to Blackboard
- [ ] GitHub link provided in submission
- [ ] Both submitted before deadline

## Before You Submit

### Quality Check
- [ ] All team members have read the final paper
- [ ] Spelling and grammar checked
- [ ] Formatting is consistent throughout
- [ ] All figures and tables properly labeled
- [ ] All sources cited correctly

### Data Visualization Check
- [ ] At least 2 figures/tables included
- [ ] All visualizations have titles and labels
- [ ] Axes are clearly labeled (if applicable)
- [ ] Visualizations are readable and relevant

### Team Communication
- [ ] All team members agree the paper is ready
- [ ] All concerns addressed
- [ ] All feedback from instructor incorporated
- [ ] GitHub shows collaborative effort

## Common Issues to Watch For

- ❌ Missing citations or unformatted references
- ❌ Inconsistent formatting or heading levels
- ❌ Missing data visualizations
- ❌ Unreadable or poorly labeled figures/tables
- ❌ GitHub repository not shared with all team members
- ❌ Rendering errors in Quarto
- ❌ Spelling and grammar errors
- ❌ Missing sections or incomplete content
- ❌ Unresolved merge conflicts in Git

## Dividing Work Effectively

**Suggested team breakdown:**

- **Person A:** Introduction & Literature Review
- **Person B:** Methods & Results
- **Person C:** Discussion, References & Proofing
- **All:** Design visualizations, proof final copy

## Questions or Problems?

If something doesn't work:
1. Check the [Troubleshooting Guide](../troubleshooting/troubleshooting.html)
2. Review the [Undergraduate Technical Guide](undergrad-technical-guide.html)
3. Review the [GitHub Guide](undergrad-github-guide.html) for collaboration tips
4. Ask your instructor

**Great job working as a team! Good luck with your submission!**
